output: Brusque secured a 3-1 victory over Mirassol in the opening round of the 2024 Serie B season at Estádio Doutor Hercílio Luz in Itajaí, Santa Catarina. Rodolfo Potiguar opened the scoring for Brusque in the 8th minute, giving the home team a 1-0 lead at halftime. Mirassol equalized early in the second half with a penalty goal from Dellatorre in the 50th minute, but an own goal by Luiz Otávio in the 67th minute restored Brusque's lead. Anderson Rosa sealed the win for Brusque with a goal in the 90+7th minute. The match saw several yellow cards and substitutions, with Jefferson Ferreira de Moraes officiating the game.

Deportivo Garcilaso and Cuiabá played to a 1-1 draw in their CONMEBOL Sudamericana Group Stage match at Estadio Inca Garcilaso de la Vega in Cusco. After a goalless first half, the game saw significant action in the second half, starting with a red card for Deportivo Garcilaso's Aldair Salazar in the 53rd minute for violent conduct. Cuiabá took the lead in the 73rd minute with a goal from I. Pitta, assisted by Denilson, but Deportivo Garcilaso equalized just three minutes later through C. Beltrán. The match also saw several substitutions and cards, including a red card for Cuiabá's Clayson in the 89th minute. Despite the late drama, neither team could find a winner, and the match ended level.

Sportivo Trinidense secured a 2-0 victory over Nacional Potosí in the CONMEBOL Sudamericana Group Stage match held at Estadio Defensores del Chaco in Asunción. The home team took the lead in the 15th minute with a goal from F. Romero and doubled their advantage in the 62nd minute through J. Salcedo, assisted by O. Giménez. The match saw several substitutions, with both teams making tactical changes throughout the second half. Yellow cards were issued to W. Alonso and T. Rayer of Sportivo Trinidense, as well as P. Azogue of Nacional Potosí. Referee F. Gilabert officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes with Sportivo Trinidense emerging as the winners.

Atletico-MG secured a 3-2 victory over Penarol in a CONMEBOL Libertadores Group Stage match held at Arena MRV in Belo Horizonte. Gustavo Scarpa opened the scoring in the 15th minute, followed by a goal from Paulinho in the 26th minute, giving Atletico-MG a 2-0 lead at halftime. Scarpa added another goal in the 57th minute, but Penarol responded with goals from M. Olivera in the 60th minute and M. Silvera in the 68th minute to narrow the deficit. The match saw several substitutions and yellow cards, with Atletico-MG's Renzo Saravia, Otavio, Jemerson, and A. Franco, as well as Penarol's M. Olivera and D. Aguirre, receiving cautions. Referee A. Rojas officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes of regulation time.

Liverpool Montevideo secured a 1-0 victory over San Lorenzo in their CONMEBOL Libertadores Group Stage match at Estadio Centenario in Montevideo. The game remained goalless in the first half, with both teams unable to break the deadlock. The decisive moment came in the 90th minute plus stoppage time when F. Nicola scored the only goal of the match for Liverpool Montevideo. San Lorenzo received four yellow cards during the game, with G. Luján, J. Romana, and E. Remedi being cautioned for various infractions. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the match, but Liverpool Montevideo's late goal proved to be the difference.

Argentinos JRS secured a 1-0 victory over Corinthians in their CONMEBOL Sudamericana Group Stage match at the Estadio Diego Armando Maradona. The only goal of the game came early in the 2nd minute, scored by Gastón Verón with an assist from Emiliano Viveros. The match saw a total of nine yellow cards, with five issued to Argentinos JRS and three to Corinthians, while Corinthians' Raul Gustavo received a red card in the 59th minute for violent conduct. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the game, with Corinthians making five changes and Argentinos JRS making the same number. The referee, P. Maza, officiated the match, which concluded after 90 minutes with no additional time.

The CONMEBOL Libertadores Group Stage match between Colo Colo and Alianza Lima ended in a goalless draw at the Estadio Monumental David Arellano in Santiago de Chile. Both teams struggled to find the back of the net, with the score remaining 0-0 at halftime and fulltime. The game saw a total of eight yellow cards, with Colo Colo receiving five and Alianza Lima three, highlighting a physical contest. Multiple substitutions were made by both sides in the second half, but neither team managed to break the deadlock. Referee D. Herrera officiated the match, which concluded after 90 minutes of play.

Tigres FC secured a 1-0 victory over Cucuta in the 2nd Round of the Copa Colombia at the Estadio Metropolitano de Techo in Bogotá. The first half ended goalless, but Cucuta faced a setback in the 28th minute when they were reduced to 10 men due to a red card. The decisive moment came in stoppage time, with O. Aragon scoring the only goal of the match in the 90’+3 minute. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the second half, with Tigres FC making three changes and Cucuta making five. The match was officiated by referee H. Rivera and concluded after 90 minutes of play.

Real España secured a 2-1 victory over Génesis in the Liga Nacional Clausura Round 17 match held at Estadio Olímpico Metropolitano in San Pedro Sula. The home team took an early lead with goals from J. Varela in the 35th minute and A. Tatum in first-half stoppage time, giving them a 2-0 advantage at halftime. Génesis managed to pull one back in the 90th+6 minute through R. Moreira but could not find an equalizer. The match saw several disciplinary actions, including a red card for Real España's L. Lopez in the 84th minute and multiple yellow cards for both teams. Substitutions were frequent, with both sides making tactical changes throughout the game.

Cavalry FC secured a 1-0 victory over Vancouver FC in the Preliminary Round of the 2024 Canadian Championship at ATCO Field in Calgary, Alberta. The match remained goalless in the first half, but Cavalry's T. Warschewski broke the deadlock in the 66th minute with the only goal of the game. Cavalry faced a setback in the 61st minute when S. Shome received a red card, leaving them with ten players for the remainder of the match. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the game, with Vancouver FC unable to capitalize on their numerical advantage. The match was officiated by referee P. Lauziere and concluded after 90 minutes of play.

Universidad Católica secured a 3-1 victory over Alianza Petrolera in their CONMEBOL Sudamericana Group Stage match at Estadio Armando Maestre Pavajeau. Alianza Petrolera took an early lead in the 8th minute with a goal from E. Batalla, assisted by J. Castillo, but Universidad Católica equalized in the 56th minute through an own goal by P. Franco. The away team then extended their lead with goals from J. Cifuente in the 68th minute and I. Díaz in the 78th minute. The match saw several yellow cards, with both teams committing fouls, and multiple substitutions were made throughout the game. Referee Y. Falcón officiated the match, which concluded after 90 minutes.

Junior and LDU de Quito played to a 1-1 draw in their CONMEBOL Libertadores Group Stage match at the Estadio Metropolitano Roberto Meléndez in Barranquilla. Junior took the lead early in the 12th minute with a penalty converted by C. Bacca, but LDU de Quito equalized just before halftime with a penalty scored by A. Arce in the 45th minute. The match saw several yellow cards, including one for C. Bacca in the 80th minute and another for A. Arce in stoppage time. Both teams made multiple substitutions throughout the game, with LDU de Quito making their final change in the 90th minute plus two. Referee F. Tello officiated the match, which ended after 90 minutes of regulation time.

Colombia U20 Women secured a 1-0 victory over Peru U20 Women in the Final Round of the CONMEBOL U20 Femenino tournament. The match, held at Estadio Modelo Alberto Spencer Herrera in Guayaquil, remained goalless in the first half. The decisive moment came in the 82nd minute when M. Álvarez scored a penalty for Colombia. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the game, with Colombia making five changes and Peru three. The match was officiated by referee A. Quisbert and concluded after 90 minutes of play.

Club América and Pachuca faced off in the semi-finals of the 2024 CONCACAF Champions League at Estadio Azteca, with the match ending in a 1-1 draw. Club América took the lead in the 12th minute with a goal from Á. Zendejas, assisted by H. Martín, but Pachuca equalized in the 40th minute through A. Micolta, assisted by O. Idrissi. The game saw several yellow cards, including one for Zendejas in the first half and three for Pachuca players in the second half. Both teams made multiple substitutions in the second half, but neither side could find a winning goal. The match was officiated by referee I. Elfath and concluded after 90 minutes of play.

Bay Olympic secured a narrow 1-0 victory over Auckland City in the National League - Northern match held at the Croatian Cultural Club 1 in Auckland. The only goal of the game came early in the 6th minute, scored by R. Muñoz for Bay Olympic. Auckland City made three substitutions during the second half, with J. Lee, S. Ukich, and C. Gray coming on to try and change the game. Bay Olympic also utilized their bench, making three substitutions, including J. Woolford, S. Stephan, and E. Kostandini Ziu. Despite Auckland City's efforts, the scoreline remained unchanged, and Bay Olympic emerged as the winners.

Bali United secured a 2-0 victory over Persebaya Surabaya in their Liga 1 clash at Stadion Gelora Bung Tomo in Surabaya. The first goal came in the 35th minute when I. Jaya scored with an assist from Éber Bessa, giving Bali United a 1-0 lead at halftime. In the second half, P. Mbarga doubled the lead in the 73rd minute, also assisted by Éber Bessa. The match saw several substitutions and yellow cards, with Bali United receiving three bookings and Persebaya Surabaya one. Referee A. Yandis officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes with Bali United emerging as the winners.

Ska-Khabarovsk secured a 2-1 victory over Rodina Moskva in a First League match held at Stadion imeni V.I. Lenina in Khabarovsk. After a goalless first half, O. Kozhemyakin opened the scoring for Ska-Khabarovsk in the 49th minute. Rodina Moskva equalized in the 75th minute through A. Kalmykov, but Kozhemyakin struck again in the 78th minute to restore the lead for the home team. The match saw several substitutions and yellow cards, including one for Tomas Rukas of Ska-Khabarovsk in the 31st minute and another for Soltmurad Bakaev of Rodina Moskva in the 57th minute. Referee I. Abrosimov officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes of play.

Central Coast Mariners secured a 3-0 victory over Abdish-Ata in the AFC Cup Inter-zonal Finals at Industree Group Stadium in Gosford. After a goalless first half, the Mariners broke the deadlock in the 77th minute with a goal from M. Di Pizio. Mikael Doka extended the lead in the 86th minute, and Di Pizio added his second goal in stoppage time to seal the win. The match saw several yellow cards, with both teams receiving cautions for fouls and arguments. Abdish-Ata made five substitutions in the second half, but they were unable to find a breakthrough against the Mariners' defense.

Sanfrecce Hiroshima secured a dominant 6-0 victory over Nara Club in the 2nd Round of the J-League Cup at Konoike Athletic Stadium in Nara. The scoring began in the 43rd minute with a goal from Y. Kashiwa, followed by five more goals in the second half, including strikes from Y. Ohashi, M. Mitsuta, S. Higashi, P. Sotiriou, and a penalty by Marcos Júnior. Nara Club faced challenges, including a red card for T. Sekiguchi in the 73rd minute and two yellow cards for Y. Sawada and Y. Tsunami. Sanfrecce Hiroshima made effective use of their substitutions, while Nara Club struggled to find the net. The match was officiated by referee Y. Imamura and concluded after 90 minutes of regular time.

Kashiwa Reysol secured a 3-1 victory over Thespakusatsu Gunma in the 2nd Round of the J-League Cup at Shoda Shoyu Stadium in Maebashi. Kashiwa dominated the first half, scoring three goals through Y. Muto in the 33rd minute, Y. Tatsuta in the 40th minute, and S. Toshima in stoppage time. Thespakusatsu Gunma managed to pull one back in the 90th minute through R. Sato but could not close the gap further. The match saw several substitutions from both teams, with Thespakusatsu Gunma making six changes and Kashiwa Reysol making five. Referee A. Ikeuchi officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes with no extra time played.

Fagiano Okayama and Yokohama FC faced off in the 2nd Round of the 2024 J-League Cup at City Light Stadium in Okayama, with the match ending in a 3-3 draw after extra time. The game saw an early goal from Y. Tanaka for Fagiano Okayama in the 15th minute, followed by an equalizer from H. Ogura of Yokohama FC in the 42nd minute. Both teams exchanged goals in the second half, with S. Sakuragawa scoring for Yokohama FC and T. Kimura and Y. Tanaka finding the net for Fagiano Okayama. In extra time, Caprini scored for Yokohama FC in the 107th minute, but Y. Tanaka completed his brace to secure the draw. The match featured several substitutions and a yellow card for Nguyen Cong Phuong of Yokohama FC in the first half.

FC Ryukyu secured a 2-1 victory over Gamba Osaka in the 2nd Round of the J-League Cup at Tapic Kenso Hiyagon Stadium in Okinawa. Y. Tomidokoro opened the scoring for FC Ryukyu in the 43rd minute, giving the home team a 1-0 lead at halftime. Gamba Osaka equalized early in the second half with a goal from T. Suzuki in the 49th minute, but H. Shirai restored FC Ryukyu's lead in the 76th minute. The match saw several substitutions and three yellow cards, with S. Kurata, Y. Sato, and R. Noda being booked. Referee K. Fukushima officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes with FC Ryukyu advancing to the next stage.

Blaublitz Akita secured a 2-1 victory over Shonan Bellmare in the 2nd Round of the J-League Cup after extra time at Soyu Stadium in Akita. The match remained goalless at halftime, but Shonan Bellmare took the lead in the 54th minute with a goal from S. Fukuda. Blaublitz Akita equalized in the 74th minute through S. Aoki, forcing the game into extra time. In the 97th minute, R. Komatsu scored the decisive goal for Blaublitz Akita. The game saw several substitutions and yellow cards, with referee Y. Yamashita officiating the match.

In the 2nd Round of the 2024 J-League Cup, Parceiro Nagano defeated Kyoto Sanga 3-2 after extra time at the Minami Nagano Sports Park Stadium. Kyoto Sanga took an early lead with goals from R. Iida in the 14th minute and S. Hiraga in the 28th minute, but N. Sanda pulled one back for Parceiro Nagano in the 39th minute. The match ended 2-2 in regular time after T. Kuroishi equalized for Parceiro Nagano in the 83rd minute. In extra time, H. Sugii scored the decisive goal in the 109th minute to secure the victory for the home team. The match featured several substitutions and was officiated by referee K. Koya.

Yokohama F. Marinos defeated Ulsan Hyundai FC in a thrilling AFC Champions League semi-final match at Nissan Stadium, Yokohama. The game ended 3-2 in regular time, with Yokohama's A. Uenaka scoring twice and Anderson Lopes adding another, while Ulsan responded with goals from Matheus Sales and a penalty by D. Bojanić. Yokohama played with ten men from the 39th minute after Takumi Kamijima received a red card for a professional foul. The match proceeded to a penalty shootout, where Yokohama triumphed 5-4, with Eduardo scoring the decisive penalty. Referee A. Faghani officiated the match, which concluded after 120 minutes of intense play.

Kataller Toyama and Shimizu S-Pulse faced off in the 2nd Round of the J-League Cup at the Toyama Athletic Recreation Park Stadium. The match ended in a 0-0 draw after regular and extra time, with Kataller Toyama securing victory 1-0 in the penalty shootout. The game saw several substitutions from both teams, with Kataller Toyama making six changes and Shimizu S-Pulse making five. Yellow cards were issued to Y. Kawai and S. Yasumitsu of Kataller Toyama, as well as S. Kotake of Shimizu S-Pulse. The match was officiated by referee F. Nakamura and concluded after 120 minutes of play.

Sagan Tosu secured a 1-0 victory over Roasso Kumamoto in the 2nd Round of the J-League Cup at Egao Kenko Stadium in Kumamoto. The only goal of the match came in the 26th minute, scored by A. Yokoyama for Sagan Tosu. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the game, with Sagan Tosu making five changes and Roasso Kumamoto making four. Roasso Kumamoto's S. Osaki received a yellow card in the 67th minute. The match was officiated by referee Y. Nishimura and concluded after 90 minutes with no additional time or penalties.

Urawa secured a decisive 5-2 victory over Gainare Tottori in the 2nd Round of the 2024 J-League Cup at Axis Bird Stadium in Tottori. The match began with Urawa taking an early lead through goals by H. Takeda in the 12th minute and Thiago Santana via a penalty in the 17th minute, while K. Tanaka scored for Gainare Tottori in the 35th minute to make it 2-1 at halftime. In the second half, Urawa extended their lead with goals from A. Ito, S. Nakajima (who scored twice), and a late goal in stoppage time. Gainare Tottori managed to add another goal in the 64th minute through S. Matsuki but could not close the gap. The game also saw several substitutions and yellow cards, with K. Oshiro and S. Nakajima receiving bookings.

In the League Cup quarter-finals held at Singha Chiangrai Stadium, Port FC secured a 2-1 victory over Chiangrai United. The home team took an early lead in the 13th minute with a goal from Miguel Bianconi, but Port FC quickly equalized five minutes later through B. Phala. In the second half, N. Shimura scored the decisive goal for Port FC in the 69th minute. The match saw several yellow cards, including one for Chiangrai United's S. Tiatrakul and Port FC's S. Bureerat during first-half stoppage time. Both teams made multiple substitutions, but Port FC held on to their lead to advance to the next round.

Leeds United U18 secured a dominant 5-0 victory over Derby County U18 in the U18 Premier League - North. The match, held at Thorp Arch Grange in Leeds, saw Leeds take a 1-0 lead at halftime with a goal from O. Pickles in the 40th minute. In the second half, Leeds extended their lead with goals from H. Vincent, H. Gray (twice), and J. McDonald. The game featured several disciplinary actions, including yellow cards for both teams and a red card for Leeds' C. Bird in the 86th minute. Despite the late sending-off, Leeds maintained control to secure the win.

In the Second League A - Spring Season Gold match, Murom secured a 2-1 victory over Krasnodar 2 at the Stadion Akademii FK Krasnodar. Krasnodar 2 faced an early setback when D. A. Golikov received a red card in the 14th minute, leaving the team with ten players. Despite this, G. Zhilkin scored in first-half stoppage time to give Krasnodar 2 a 1-0 lead at halftime. Murom responded in the second half, with V. Kozlov equalizing in the 88th minute and A. Murza scoring the decisive goal in the 90th+4 minute. The match saw multiple substitutions and a yellow card for A. Murza in the closing moments, with referee M. Chembulatov officiating the game.

In the League Cup Quarter-finals held at Dragon Solar Park in Ratchaburi, Bangkok Glass secured a decisive 3-0 victory over Ratchaburi. The scoring began early with Danilo Alves finding the net in the 8th minute, giving Bangkok Glass a 1-0 lead at halftime. In the second half, Chanathip Songkrasin scored twice, in the 85th and 89th minutes, to seal the win for the away team. The match also saw several substitutions and two yellow cards issued to Bangkok Glass players, P. Dokmaikeaw and W. Sawatlakhorn, in the first half. Referee C. Ngamsom officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes with Bangkok Glass advancing to the next round.

In an exciting Liga 1 match held at Stadion Brawijaya in Kediri, Persik Kediri and PSS Sleman played to a thrilling 4-4 draw. The first half saw PSS Sleman take a 3-2 lead, with goals from J. Bustos, Thales, and E. Vizcarra, while Flávio Silva scored twice for Persik Kediri from the penalty spot. The second half was equally eventful, with Flávio Silva completing his hat-trick via another penalty and F. Aditama adding a goal for Persik Kediri, while Jihad Ayoub scored a late equalizer for PSS Sleman. The match also featured numerous cards, including a red card for J. Bustos of PSS Sleman in the 48th minute. Both teams made several substitutions, but neither could secure a decisive victory in this high-scoring encounter.

Buriram United secured a 2-1 victory over Lamphun Warrior in the League Cup Quarter-finals after extra time at Chang Arena in Buriram. The match remained goalless at halftime, with both teams scoring once in the second half—Bissoli netting for Buriram United in the 72nd minute and A. Pumwisat equalizing for Lamphun Warrior in the 88th minute. The game extended into extra time, where Dion Cools scored the decisive goal in the 119th minute for Buriram United. The match saw several yellow cards, with Lamphun Warrior receiving the majority, and both teams made multiple substitutions throughout the game. Referee W. Sassadee officiated the match, which concluded after 120 minutes.

Novosibirsk and Rodina Moskva II played to a 1-1 draw in their Second League A - Spring Season Gold match on April 24, 2024, at RFTs Zarya manezh in Novosibirsk. Novosibirsk took an early lead in the 8th minute with a goal from A. Kobyalko, but Rodina Moskva II equalized in the 74th minute through D. Shilov. The match saw several disciplinary actions, including a red card for Rodina Moskva II's I. Petukhov in the 79th minute, following a second yellow card. Both teams made multiple substitutions throughout the game, with Rodina Moskva II making their final change in stoppage time. Referee I. Pozhidaev officiated the match, which ended after 90 minutes of play.

Dinamo Moscow secured a 2-1 victory over Orenburg in their Premier League clash at Stadion Gazovik in Rostoshi. After a goalless first half, Konstantin Tyukavin opened the scoring for Dinamo Moscow in the 55th minute, followed by a second goal from Meschack Ngamaleu in the 72nd minute. Orenburg responded with a goal from Brian Mansilla in the 77th minute but could not find an equalizer. The match saw several substitutions and yellow cards, including cautions for Matías Pérez, Mohammad Ghorbani, and Andrey Malykh from Orenburg, as well as Anton Shunin and Nicolás Marichal from Dinamo Moscow. Referee E. Bulanov officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes of play.

Slovan Bratislava II secured a 3-2 victory over Malženice in a closely contested match in the Slovak 2. liga. The game started with an early goal from E. Kramár in the 1st minute, but Malženice quickly equalized through N. Kurej in the 5th minute. Both teams went into halftime level at 2-2 after additional goals from E. Isaac for Slovan Bratislava II and J. Paur for Malženice. The second half saw E. Kramár receive a red card in the 58th minute, reducing Slovan Bratislava II to 10 men, but M. Kušnír scored the decisive goal in the 90th minute to secure the win. The match also saw a red card for J. Paur of Malženice in the 72nd minute, leaving both teams with 10 players on the field.

The match between Tyumen and Chernomorets in the Russian First League ended in a 1-1 draw at Stadion Geolog in Tyumen. Chernomorets took the lead in the 39th minute with a goal from I. Zazvonkin, but Tyumen quickly equalized just two minutes later through I. Markelov. The game saw several substitutions from both teams, with Tyumen making five changes and Chernomorets also utilizing all five substitution opportunities. Discipline was a factor, as four yellow cards were issued—two to each team, including one to Chernomorets' Ivan Enin in the 22nd minute and another to Tyumen's Pavel Shadrin in the 89th minute. The match was officiated by referee R. Ziyakov and concluded after 90 minutes with no extra time played.

In the Azerbaijan Cup semi-finals, Zira secured a 2-0 victory over Qabala at Şəhər stadionu in Qəbələ. After a goalless first half, Zira's V. Kulach opened the scoring in the 59th minute with a normal goal. Later, Raphael Alemão doubled Zira's lead in the 84th minute to seal the win. The match saw several yellow cards, including one for V. Kulach in the 19th minute and others for P. Zebli and F. Bayramov in the second half. Referee T. Qurbanov officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes of play.

Korabi Peshkopi secured a decisive 5-1 victory over Luzi 2008 in the 1st Division match held at Stadiumi Korabi in Peshkopi. The home team took a 2-1 lead into halftime with goals from I. Kasalla and M. Çema, while P. Treni scored for the visitors. In the second half, Korabi Peshkopi extended their lead with goals from H. Marku, I. Kasalla, and H. Reçi. Luzi 2008 made several substitutions throughout the match but were unable to turn the tide. The game was officiated by referee S. Dyrmishi and concluded after 90 minutes of play.

Mashuk-KMV secured a 1-0 victory over Dinamo Bryansk in the Second League A - Spring Season Silver match held at Central'nyj Stadion Mashuk in Pyatigorsk. The only goal of the game came in the 63rd minute, scored by M. Tlekhugov for the home team. The match saw a total of five yellow cards, with Dinamo Bryansk receiving four and Mashuk-KMV one. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the game, with Dinamo Bryansk making five changes and Mashuk-KMV also utilizing all five substitution slots. Referee K. Silantyev officiated the match, which ended after 90 minutes of play.

The match between Irtysh Omsk and Spartak Kostroma in the Second League A - Spring Season Silver ended in a goalless draw, with a final score of 0-0. Both teams received one yellow card each in the first half, with I. Karpuk of Irtysh Omsk booked in the 23rd minute and D. Sabusov of Spartak Kostroma in the 34th minute. Spartak Kostroma made five substitutions throughout the game, starting in the 46th minute, while Irtysh Omsk made two substitutions in the second half. The game was officiated by referee A. Sidorin and took place at Krytyj futbolnyj Manesh MU SK Krasnaya zvezda in Omsk. Despite several changes in personnel, neither team managed to break the deadlock, and the match concluded with no goals scored.

In a Group 1 match of the Russian Second League 2024 season, Spartak Nalchik secured a 1-0 victory over Kuban Kholding at Stadion Urozhay in Pavlovskaya. The only goal of the game came in the 20th minute, scored by D. Daliev for Spartak Nalchik. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the match, with Kuban Kholding making five changes and Spartak Nalchik making the same number, including two in stoppage time. The game was officiated by referee A. Koltunov and concluded after 90 minutes with no additional goals scored. Spartak Nalchik emerged as the winner, while Kuban Kholding failed to find the back of the net.

The match between Pobeda and Sevastopol in the Second League - Group 1 ended in a goalless draw, with neither team managing to score. The game, held at the Anzhi Sports Complex pole 3 in Kaspiysk, saw several substitutions from both sides, starting in the second half. Pobeda made three substitutions, including G. Kudbudinov coming on in the 46th minute and A. Fazylov entering in the 85th minute. Sevastopol utilized five substitutions, with D. Ivanov and V. Mironenko being introduced at the start of the second half. Referee A. Kharin officiated the match, which concluded after 90 minutes of play.

Universitatea Cluj secured a 1-0 victory over Politehnica Iasi in the Liga I Relegation Round at Cluj Arena. The only goal of the match came in the 53rd minute, scored by D. Popa with an assist from R. Silaghi, and was confirmed by VAR shortly after. The game saw several yellow cards, including one for Universitatea Cluj's Thalisson Kelven in the 49th minute and Politehnica Iasi's Todor Todoroski in the 69th minute. Both teams made multiple substitutions throughout the match, with Politehnica Iasi making five changes and Universitatea Cluj also utilizing their bench extensively. Referee S. Kovacs officiated the match, which concluded after 90 minutes plus stoppage time.

Alaniya Vladikavkaz secured a 3-0 victory over Urozhay in their First League match at Akhmat Arena in Groznyi. After a goalless first half, I. Mashukov opened the scoring for Alaniya Vladikavkaz in the 63rd minute. T. Gagloev added two more goals for the home team, one in the 76th minute and another in stoppage time at 90’+4. Urozhay’s Ivan Temnikov received a yellow card early in the match, and both teams made several substitutions throughout the second half. The match was officiated by referee A. Mashlyakevich and concluded with Alaniya Vladikavkaz as the clear winners.

The match between Volgar Astrakhan and Torpedo Moskva in the Russian First League ended in a 1-1 draw. Torpedo Moskva took the lead in the 39th minute with a goal from I. Gorbunov, assisted by R. Tugarev. Volgar Astrakhan equalized in the 60th minute through a goal by Vyacheslav Krotov. The game saw several substitutions and three yellow cards, with Aleksei Pavlishin, Vyacheslav Krotov, and Kirill Folmer of Volgar Astrakhan being booked. The match was officiated by referee S. Kulikov and played at Central'nyj Stadion Astrakhan'gazprom in Astrakhan'.

El Geish secured a 1-0 victory over Enppi in their Premier League clash at the Gehaz El Reyada Stadium in Cairo. The match remained goalless in the first half, with both teams unable to break the deadlock. The decisive moment came in the 90th +7 minute when Islam Mohareb scored the only goal of the game, assisted by Ahmed Samir. The game saw several yellow cards, including one for El Geish's Farid Shawky in stoppage time due to an argument. Both teams made multiple substitutions throughout the match, but El Geish's late goal proved to be the difference.

Khimik Dzerzhinsk secured a 1-0 victory over Volga Ulyanovsk in the Second League A - Spring Season Silver match held at Stadion Trud in Ulyanovsk. The only goal of the game came in the 58th minute, scored by M. Zhumabekov for Khimik Dzerzhinsk. The match saw several substitutions, with both teams making five changes each to try and influence the game. Yellow cards were issued to multiple players, including D. Rakhmanov and A. Dashayev from Volga Ulyanovsk, and A. Chubukin from Khimik Dzerzhinsk. Referee A. Smolin officiated the match, which ended after 90 minutes with no extra time played.

In a Super League 1 Championship Round match held on April 24, 2024, Lamia and PAOK played to a 1-1 draw at the Dimotiko Athlitiko Kentro Lamias. Lamia took the lead in first-half stoppage time with a goal from Vykintas Slivka, assisted by F. Malçi. PAOK equalized late in the game during the 90th+10 minute with a goal from S. Schwab, assisted by K. Despodov. The match saw several disciplinary actions, including a red card for Lamia's Pedro Amaral in stoppage time and multiple yellow cards for both teams. Both sides made numerous substitutions throughout the game, but neither could secure a decisive victory.

Deportes Santa Cruz and Deportes Limache played to a 1-1 draw in their Primera B match at the Estadio Municipal Joaquín Muñoz García. Deportes Limache took the lead in the 39th minute with a goal from F. Juárez, while P. Muñoz equalized for Deportes Santa Cruz in the 77th minute. The game saw several substitutions, with both teams making tactical changes throughout the second half. J. Abdala of Deportes Limache received a yellow card in the 26th minute, and M. Santos of Deportes Santa Cruz was shown a red card in stoppage time. Referee J. Cabero officiated the match, which concluded after 90 minutes of play.

Minnesota United II secured a 2-0 victory over Colorado Rapids II in their MLS Next Pro match at Dick's Sporting Goods Park in Commerce City, Colorado. The scoring began in the 30th minute when P. Weah converted a penalty to give Minnesota United II a 1-0 lead at halftime. The visitors doubled their advantage in the 90th minute with a goal from M. Khan, assisted by J. Banks. Colorado Rapids II received two yellow cards during the match, while Minnesota United II picked up one. The game featured multiple substitutions from both teams, but Colorado Rapids II was unable to find the back of the net.

Guatemala and Nicaragua faced off in a friendly match at PayPal Park in San Jose, California, which ended in a 1-1 draw. Guatemala took an early lead in the 11th minute with a goal from R. Rubín. Nicaragua equalized in the 61st minute through a penalty scored by H. Medina. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the match, with Nicaragua making six changes and Guatemala making the same number. The game concluded after 90 minutes, with neither side able to secure a decisive goal.

Portuguesa FC secured a 2-1 victory over Carabobo FC in the Apertura Quadrangular round at Estadio Rafael Agustín Tovar in Barinas. The home team took an early lead with goals from C. Ramírez in the 12th minute and D. Carrero in the 25th minute. Carabobo FC responded with a goal by H. Lezcano, assisted by F. Apaolaza, in the 42nd minute, but they were unable to find an equalizer. The match saw several yellow cards, with three issued to Portuguesa FC players and three to Carabobo FC players. Both teams made multiple substitutions in the second half, but the scoreline remained unchanged, confirming Portuguesa FC as the winners.

Club América secured a 1-0 victory over Cruz Azul in the Clausura Final of Liga MX at Estadio Azteca. The match remained goalless in the first half, with both teams unable to break the deadlock. In the 74th minute, a VAR review confirmed a penalty for Club América, which was successfully converted by Henry Martín in the 78th minute. The game saw several yellow cards, including one for Martín shortly after his goal, and multiple substitutions from both sides in the final minutes. Referee M. Ortíz officiated the match, which concluded with Club América crowned as the winners.

Bucheon FC 1995 secured a 3-0 victory over Asan Mugunghwa in a K League 2 match held at Bucheon Stadium on May 27, 2024. Park Hyun-Bin opened the scoring for the home team in the 32nd minute, giving them a 1-0 lead at halftime. In the second half, Jucie Lupeta scored twice, in the 59th and 82nd minutes, to seal the win for Bucheon. The match saw several substitutions and yellow cards, with Asan Mugunghwa receiving two and Bucheon FC 1995 receiving three. Referee Ahn Jae-Hoon officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes of play.

Ansan Greeners secured a 1-0 victory over Busan I Park in their K League 2 match at Ansan Wa Stadium. After a goalless first half, Choi Han-Sol scored the decisive goal in the 72nd minute for the home team. The match saw several substitutions from both sides, with Busan I Park making four changes and Ansan Greeners making five. Kim Jae-Sung and Choi Han-Sol of Ansan Greeners received yellow cards during the game. Referee Seol Tae-Hwan officiated the match, which concluded after 90 minutes of play.

In the Promotion Play-offs 3rd Round of the Turkish 2. Lig, Van BB and Hekimoğlu Trabzon played to a 1-1 draw at the Atatürk Şehir Stadyumu in Van. After a goalless first half, the game came alive in stoppage time. Van BB took the lead in the 90th +1 minute with a goal from F. Sakı. However, Hekimoğlu Trabzon equalized in the 90th +7 minute through H. Yeşil, ensuring the match ended level. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the game, but neither could secure a decisive advantage.

In the Promotion Play-offs - 3rd Round of the Turkish 2. Lig, 76 Iğdır Belediyespor secured a 3-1 victory over Kastamonuspor 1966 at the Kastamonu Gazi Stadyumu. The away team took an early lead with goals from B. Kara in the 20th minute and H. Sönmez in the 41st minute, going into halftime 2-0 ahead. In the second half, E. Soy extended the lead for 76 Iğdır Belediyespor with a goal in the 78th minute. Kastamonuspor 1966 managed to pull one back in stoppage time with a penalty scored by M. Çaylı in the 90+3 minute. The match featured several substitutions from both teams, but 76 Iğdır Belediyespor emerged as the clear winner.

Pyramids FC secured a 1-0 victory over El Gouna FC in their Premier League clash at the 30 June Air Defence Stadium in Cairo. The only goal of the match came in the 27th minute, scored by Ibrahim Adel with an assist from F. Mayele. The game saw several substitutions, with both teams making tactical changes throughout the second half. Pyramids FC's Marwan Hamdy received two yellow cards in quick succession, resulting in a red card in the 85th minute, leaving his team with ten players for the final minutes. Despite the numerical disadvantage, Pyramids FC held on to their lead, with referee Mohamed Salama overseeing the match.

Lokomotiv and Surkhon played to a 1-1 draw in their Super League match at Stadion Lokomotiv in Tashkent. The scoring began in the 12th minute when Surkhon took the lead through an own goal by Lokomotiv's A. Ismailov. Lokomotiv equalized in the 75th minute with a goal from A. Abdurashidov. The game saw several substitutions from both teams, as well as yellow cards for D. Krajisnik and A. Turdialiev of Lokomotiv. Referee K. Suyunboyev officiated the match, which ended after 90 minutes of play.

Viking II secured a dominant 5-1 victory over Lysekloster in the 2. Division - Group 1 match held at SR-Bank Arena in Stavanger. The home team took a 2-0 lead by halftime with goals from H. Tangen in the 12th minute and J. Galta in the 28th minute. Viking II extended their lead in the second half with goals from P. Christiansen, E. Austbø (who scored twice), while Lysekloster's only goal came from D. Campher in the 73rd minute. The match also saw several substitutions and two yellow cards, one for Viking II's T. Håland and two for Lysekloster players, D. Gamachis and J. Eftevaag. Referee A. Vermundsen officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes.

SJK secured a dominant 4-0 victory over Lahti in their Veikkausliiga clash at Lahden Stadion. All four goals were scored in the first half, with Fallou Ndiaye opening the scoring in the 9th minute, followed by goals from Kalle Paananen, Babacar Fati, and Sadiq Yussif. Pyry Hannola of SJK received a yellow card just before halftime, while Lahti's Pablo Andrade was also booked in the 80th minute. Both teams made several substitutions in the second half, but the scoreline remained unchanged. The match was officiated by referee P. Simani and concluded after 90 minutes with no extra time.

VPS secured a 3-1 victory over Inter Turku in a Veikkausliiga match held at Lemonsoft Stadion in Vaasa. VPS took an early lead in the first half with goals from Evgeny Bashkirov in the 17th minute and Miro Haukioja in the 26th minute, going into halftime 2-0 up. Inter Turku managed to pull one back in stoppage time through Joonas Kekarainen, but VPS responded immediately with a late goal from Gyrano Vlijter in the 90+3 minute to seal the win. The match saw several yellow cards, including one for Bashkirov in the 5th minute and two for Inter Turku players in the closing stages. Both teams made multiple substitutions in the second half, but VPS maintained control to claim the three points.

Italy U17 secured a 2-1 victory over Sweden U17 in their UEFA U17 Championship Group Stage match at Stadio Tasos Markou in Paralímni. After a goalless first half, Sweden took the lead in the 57th minute with a goal from F. Bozicevic, assisted by A. Redkin. Italy responded in the 75th minute with a goal from C. Cama, followed by the decisive strike from F. Camarda in the 80th minute. The match saw several substitutions and two yellow cards, one for each team, with N. O. Jonsson of Sweden and C. Cama of Italy being booked. Referee N. Minaković officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes.

Poland U17 secured a dominant 4-0 victory over Slovakia U17 in their UEFA U17 Championship Group Stage match at Stadio Dasaki Achnas. The game saw Poland take an early lead with a goal from M. Izunwanne in the 11th minute, followed by goals from O. Pietuszewski and another from Izunwanne before halftime. S. Gieroba added a fourth goal in the second half to seal the win. Slovakia U17 received two yellow cards in the first half and made several substitutions in an attempt to change the game, but they were unable to find the back of the net. The match was officiated by referee D. Fuxman and concluded after 90 minutes with Poland emerging as the clear winners.

Kooteepee secured a 2-1 victory over KäPa in the Ykkösliiga match held at Arto Tolsa Areena in Kotka. The game began with an early goal from A. Tarvonen for Kooteepee in the 11th minute, but KäPa equalized through E. Kallio in the 27th minute, leaving the score tied 1-1 at halftime. The decisive moment came in the 80th minute when A. Tanninen scored the winning goal for Kooteepee. The match saw several substitutions and a flurry of cards, including a red card for KäPa in the 89th minute. Referee M. Haapakoski officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes of play.

In a Ykkösliiga match held at Algeco Areena TN in Helsinki, PK-35 and SalPa played to a 1-1 draw. PK-35 took the lead in the 34th minute with a penalty goal scored by E. Markkanen, shortly after SalPa's B. Haruna was sent off with a red card following two yellow cards. SalPa equalized in stoppage time (90'+3) with a goal from Olli Jakonen. The game saw a total of nine yellow cards, with SalPa receiving seven, including the red card for Haruna. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the match, and the referee for the game was J. Nieminen.

Kolkheti Poti and Dinamo Tbilisi played out a 2-2 draw in their Erovnuli Liga match at the Kobuleti Football Center. Dinamo Tbilisi took an early lead in the 3rd minute through Ó. Santis, but G. Kharebava equalized for Kolkheti Poti in the 20th minute. In the second half, G. Melkadze put Kolkheti Poti ahead in the 65th minute, only for Dinamo Tbilisi to level the score in stoppage time with a goal from G. Moistsrapishvili. The match also saw several substitutions and two yellow cards, one for B. Kharshiladze of Kolkheti Poti and another for Cadete of Dinamo Tbilisi. Referee G. Kikacheishvili officiated the game, which ended after 90 minutes of play.

In a Meistriliiga match held on May 27, 2024, at Tamme staadion in Tartu, Trans Narva secured a 2-0 victory over Tammeka. The first goal came in first-half stoppage time (45' +1) from T. Usta, giving Trans Narva a 1-0 lead at halftime. S. Kukhianidze doubled the lead in the 89th minute to seal the win for the away team. The match saw several yellow cards, with D. Polyakov, G. Slein, and multiple Tammeka players, including M. Sepp and P. Peedo, being booked. Tammeka made four substitutions during the game, but they were unable to find the back of the net.

Zamalek SC secured a 2-0 victory over Al Ittihad in the Egyptian Premier League's Regular Season Round 25 at Borg El Arab Stadium in Alexandria. The scoring began in the 28th minute when Nasser Maher, assisted by Omar Gaber, put Zamalek ahead. S. Jaziri doubled the lead in the 57th minute with a goal assisted by I. Ndiaye. Al Ittihad made several substitutions in an attempt to turn the game around, but they were unable to find the back of the net. The match saw a few disciplinary actions, including yellow cards for Al Ittihad players Omar El Wahsh, Mabululu, and Abdelghani Mohamed, while a late VAR review canceled a potential third goal for Zamalek.

Brann II secured a decisive 7-3 victory over Vard in a high-scoring match in the Norwegian 2. Division - Group 1. The game, held at Varden Amfi in Bergen, saw Brann II's D. Tufekcic score a hat-trick in the first half, contributing significantly to their lead. Vard managed to score three goals, with T. Dvergsdal, S. Jensen, and A. Harvey finding the net, but it was not enough to match Brann II's offensive dominance. The second half featured additional goals from M. Haaland, M. Haga, and J. Eikrem for Brann II, sealing their win. The match also included several substitutions and two yellow cards, one for each team, with referee S. Brudvik officiating the game.

Kongsvinger secured a 2-0 victory over Sandnes ULF in their 1. Division clash at Øster Hus Arena on May 27, 2024. The visitors took an early lead in the 7th minute with a goal from L. Haren and doubled their advantage in the 43rd minute through J. Grundt. Sandnes ULF received three yellow cards during the match, with V. Solheim, H. Brkic, and E. Derviskadic being cautioned, while Kongsvinger saw yellow cards for L. Haren and J. Nilsson. Both teams made several substitutions in the second half, but Sandnes ULF was unable to find a breakthrough. The match was officiated by referee S. Hauge and concluded after 90 minutes with no additional time.

Egersund secured a dramatic 5-4 victory over Stabaek in a high-scoring match in the Norwegian 1. Division at Nadderud Stadion. Stabaek dominated the first half, taking a 3-0 lead with goals from T. Roberts, O. Spiten-Nysæter, and S. Olderheim. However, Egersund mounted an impressive comeback in the second half, with A. Helmersen scoring twice and additional goals from J. Salmon, M. Dahlby, and H. Elvevold sealing the win. Stabaek added a fourth goal through R. Vinge but could not hold off Egersund's relentless attack. The match saw several yellow cards and substitutions, with referee E. Bodding overseeing the action.

Bryne secured a 3-2 victory over Ranheim in a closely contested match in the Norwegian 1. Division at Bryne Stadion. Ranheim opened the scoring in the 19th minute through G. Mogensen, but Bryne equalized just before halftime with a goal from L. Sødal in the 43rd minute. In the second half, Duarte Moreira put Bryne ahead in the 66th minute, and despite a late goal from S. Haugen for Ranheim in the 90th minute, A. Dybevik sealed the win for Bryne with a stoppage-time goal in the 90’+4 minute. The match also saw several yellow cards, including three for Ranheim in the first half and one for Bryne in the second half. Substitutions were made by both teams, but Bryne held on to claim the win.

Moss secured a 2-1 victory over Mjondalen in their 1. Division clash at Consto Arena. The scoring opened in the 27th minute with a goal from Moss's T. Jakobsen, giving the visitors a halftime lead. Mjondalen equalized shortly after the break through M. Pedersen in the 47th minute, but Moss regained the lead in the 54th minute with a goal from S. Pedersen. The match saw several substitutions and yellow cards, with Mjondalen receiving three and Moss two. Referee M. Berg officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes of regular time.

Raufoss secured a 1-0 victory over Lyn in their 1. Division match at NAMMO stadion in Raufoss. After a goalless first half, J. Lynum scored the decisive goal in the 71st minute for the home team. The match saw several substitutions, with Lyn making five changes and Raufoss making three. Yellow cards were issued to Raufoss players M. Alm, T. Engebakken, and J. Lynum during the game. The match was officiated by referee A. Medic and concluded after 90 minutes of play.

Aalesund secured a 4-1 victory over Asane in the 1. Division match held at Color Line Stadion in Ålesund. The home team took a 2-0 lead by halftime with goals from I. Atanga in the 28th minute and J. Kitolano in the 35th minute. In the second half, Aalesund extended their lead with goals from Cláudio Braga in the 79th minute and M. Diop in the 82nd minute, while Asane managed a late consolation goal by T. Lotsberg in stoppage time. The match also saw several yellow cards, with Asane receiving three, including one for O. Kallevag in the 74th minute. Substitutions were frequent, with both teams making multiple changes throughout the game.

In a Round 17 match of the 2024 Erovnuli Liga season, Dila secured a 2-0 victory over Dinamo Batumi at the Batumi Arena. After a goalless first half, T. Wouter opened the scoring for Dila in the 71st minute with a normal goal. Wouter struck again in the 78th minute, doubling the lead and sealing the win for the away team. Dinamo Batumi made several substitutions in the second half but were unable to find the back of the net. The match, officiated by referee A. Aptsiauri, concluded with Dila as the clear winners.

Trelleborgs FF secured a 3-2 victory over GIF Sundsvall in a closely contested Superettan match at Vångavallen. The home team took the lead in the first half with a goal from E. Alievski in the 30th minute. The second half saw an intense exchange of goals, with F. Bohman scoring for Trelleborgs in the 82nd minute and Y. Finey responding for GIF Sundsvall in the 88th and 90+3 minutes, the latter being a penalty. Trelleborgs sealed the win in stoppage time with a goal from N. Mortensen in the 90+4 minute. The match also featured several yellow cards and substitutions, with both teams displaying a competitive spirit throughout.

Utsikten secured a 1-0 victory over IK Brage in their Superettan clash at Bravida Arena in Göteborg. The match remained goalless in the first half, but Utsikten broke the deadlock in the 85th minute with a penalty scored by F. Trpcevski. The game saw several substitutions from both teams, with Utsikten making five changes and IK Brage making three. Yellow cards were issued to players from both sides, including Albin Skoglund of Utsikten and Johan Arvidsson of IK Brage. Referee F. Ben Ahmed Nehdi officiated the match, which concluded after 90 minutes of play.

In a Round 11 Allsvenskan match held at PlatinumCars Arena in Norrköping, IFK Värnamo secured a dominant 4-0 victory over IFK Norrköping. The scoring began in the 15th minute with a goal from J. Kalu, assisted by V. Bergh, giving the visitors a 1-0 lead at halftime. J. Kalu struck again in the 69th minute, followed by goals from G. Engvall in the 73rd minute and C. Johansson in stoppage time (90’+2). IFK Norrköping received two yellow cards in the first half, while IFK Värnamo also saw two players booked during the match. The game featured several substitutions from both sides, but IFK Norrköping was unable to find the back of the net, leaving IFK Värnamo as the clear winners.

FC Gomel secured a 1-0 victory over FC Dnepr Mogilev in their Premier League clash at Stadyen Spartak in Mogilev. The match remained goalless through the first half, with both teams unable to break the deadlock. The decisive moment came in the 90th +2 minute when R. Effaghe scored the only goal of the game for FC Gomel. FC Dnepr Mogilev received two yellow cards during the match, with Nikita Krasnov booked in the 33rd minute and Yuri Klochkov in stoppage time. The game featured multiple substitutions from both sides, but FC Gomel emerged as the winners at the final whistle.

Lund secured a 2-1 victory over Olympic in their Ettan - Södra clash at Lindängens IP in Malmö. Olympic took an early lead in the 20th minute with a goal from A. Sundgren, but Lund equalized in the 35th minute through A. Kamp. Despite being reduced to 10 men after J. Andersson received a red card in the 28th minute, Lund managed to score the decisive goal in the 77th minute, courtesy of E. Zetterberg. The match saw several substitutions and a total of six yellow cards, with Olympic receiving four and Lund two. Referee P. Lindh officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes.

In a closely contested match in the Ettan - Södra league, Angelholms FF secured a 2-1 victory over Jonkopings Sodra at Stadsparksvallen in Jönköping. Angelholms FF took an early lead in the 13th minute with a goal from A. Gustafson, while Jonkopings Sodra equalized in the 51st minute through L. Lyck. However, M. Eriksson restored Angelholms FF's lead in the 60th minute, which proved to be the decisive goal. The game saw several substitutions and yellow cards, with T. Amilon Persson, J. Lindgren, H. Israelsson, and R. Streifert among those booked. Referee K. Gerxhaliu officiated the match, which concluded after 90 minutes of regular time and additional stoppage time.

Skeid secured a 3-1 victory over Vålerenga II in their 2. Division - Group 2 match at Intility Arena in Oslo. The game started with Skeid's K. Kalabatama scoring the opening goal in the 15th minute, followed by Vålerenga II's A. Rønning equalizing in the 42nd minute. In the second half, Kalabatama struck again in the 49th minute, and U. Ness added a third goal for Skeid in the 67th minute to seal the win. The match saw several substitutions and yellow cards, with both teams making tactical changes throughout. Referee H. Catalgöl officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes.

CSKA 1948 secured a 2-0 victory over Slavia Sofia in the Conference League Play-off Group match held at Stadion Aleksandar Shalamanov in Sofia. Pedrinho opened the scoring for CSKA 1948 in the 5th minute with a normal goal, giving the visitors an early lead. The second goal came in the 63rd minute, scored by N. Iliev, solidifying CSKA 1948's dominance. The match saw several substitutions and yellow cards, with players like Parvizdzhon Umarbaev, Teodor Ivanov, and Nedeljko Piščević receiving cautions for fouls. Referee G. Ginchev officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes with CSKA 1948 emerging as the winners.

Arda Kardzhali secured a 1-0 victory over Botev Plovdiv in the Conference League Play-off Group match held at Stadion Hristo Botev in Plovdiv. The only goal of the game came in the 37th minute, scored by T. Yordanov for Arda Kardzhali. The match saw several yellow cards, all issued to Arda Kardzhali players, including Stanislav Ivanov, Okezie Prince Ebenezer, and Plamen Krachunov. Both teams made multiple substitutions in the second half, with Arda Kardzhali making four changes and Botev Plovdiv making five. Referee V. El Hatib officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes with no additional time.

The Liga I relegation round match between Csikszereda and Dinamo Bucuresti ended in a goalless draw, with neither team managing to score. The game, held at Stadionul Municipal in Miercurea Ciuc, saw a total of four yellow cards, with Dávid Kelemen, Ahmed Bani, and Benjamin Babati among those booked. Both teams made several substitutions throughout the match, with Csikszereda making four changes and Dinamo Bucuresti making five. Despite the efforts of both sides, the match concluded with a 0-0 scoreline after 90 minutes. The referee for the game was H. Feșnic.

Maghreb Fès and Hassania Agadir played to a 2-2 draw in their Botola Pro match at Stade Hassan-II in Fès. The home team opened the scoring early in the 8th minute through M. Bouriga, but H. Afsal equalized for Hassania Agadir in the 25th minute. The second half saw S. El Moudane convert a penalty in the 62nd minute to give Hassania Agadir the lead, but M. Bouriga responded with a penalty of his own in the 77th minute to level the score. The match featured several yellow cards, with Maghreb Fès receiving four and Hassania Agadir one. Both teams made multiple substitutions late in the game, but neither could find a winner before the final whistle.

AIK Stockholm secured a 5-2 victory over IFK Goteborg in the Allsvenskan Regular Season Round 11 match held at Strawberry Arena in Solna. The first half ended in a 1-1 draw, with goals from O. Pettersson for IFK Goteborg and O. Faraj for AIK Stockholm. In the second half, AIK dominated, scoring four more goals, including an own goal by G. Svensson and late strikes from D. Beširović and I. Pittas in stoppage time. IFK Goteborg's O. Wendt added a second goal for his team early in the half, but it wasn’t enough to close the gap. The match saw several substitutions and yellow cards, with referee V. Wolf officiating the game.

France U17 secured a 2-1 victory over Portugal U17 in their UEFA U17 Championship Group Stage match at Stadio Vitex Ammochostos Epistrofi in Larnaca. The game started evenly, with E. Sternal scoring for France in the 36th minute, followed by an equalizer from Afonso Patrão for Portugal just two minutes later. The decisive moment came in the 81st minute when E. Molébé scored the winning goal for France. The match saw several substitutions and yellow cards, including cautions for M. Angely, R. Mota, and I. Kanté. Referee R. Gidzhenov officiated the game, which concluded after 90 minutes of play.

England U17 secured a 3-1 victory over Spain U17 in their UEFA U17 Championship Group Stage match at Stadio Antonis Papadopoulos in Larnaca. The game started with an early goal from S. Mheuka for England in the 6th minute, assisted by C. Olusesi, but Spain equalized in the 23rd minute through Adrián Arnu, assisted by Jesús Fortea. England regained the lead in the second half with a goal from M. Moore in the 73rd minute, followed by a third goal from E. Nwaneri in the 85th minute. Spain faced further challenges as J. Fortea received a red card in the 89th minute after an earlier yellow card. The match concluded with England as the winners, maintaining their dominance in the second half.

Al Taawon secured a 1-0 victory over Al-Ettifaq in their Pro League match at the Al Taawon Club Stadium in Buraidah. The game remained goalless in the first half, with both teams unable to break the deadlock. The decisive moment came in the 90th minute when Abdulmalik Al Oyayari scored the only goal of the match, assisted by Mohammed Al Kuwaykibi. The match saw several yellow cards, including one for Al Taawon's Ashraf El Mahdioui in first-half stoppage time and another for Al Oyayari in the 91st minute. Both teams made multiple substitutions late in the game, but Al Taawon held on to claim the win.

Al-Hazm secured a 2-1 victory over Abha in their Pro League match at Ar-Rass Stadium in Rass. After a goalless first half, Abha took the lead in the 47th minute with a goal from Ahmed Abdu, assisted by Hassan Al Ali. Al-Hazm responded with two second-half goals, the first from M. Badamosi in the 58th minute, assisted by F. Selemani, and the second from Mohammed Al Thani in the 80th minute. The match saw several substitutions and disciplinary actions, including a red card for Abha's Marcel Tisserand in stoppage time following a VAR review. Referee Faisal Alblwi officiated the game, which concluded with Al-Hazm as the winners.

Al-Nassr secured a 4-2 victory over Al-Ittihad FC in the Saudi Pro League's Regular Season Round 34 at Al Awal Park in Riyadh. Cristiano Ronaldo played a pivotal role, scoring twice, including the opening goal in first-half stoppage time, assisted by Mohammed Al Fatil. Al-Ittihad FC faced a setback in the 66th minute when Swailem Al-Menhali received a red card for a professional foul. Despite goals from Fabinho and Farhah Al Shamrani, Al-Nassr extended their lead with a penalty by Abdulrahman Ghareeb and a late goal by Meshari Al Nemer. The match saw several substitutions and cards, with referee Majed Alshamrani overseeing the game.

Al Shabab secured a 3-2 victory over Al-Fateh in a closely contested Pro League match at Al-Shabab Club Stadium in Riyadh. The home team took an early lead in the 14th minute with a goal from Hussain Al Sibyani, but Al-Fateh equalized in the 51st minute through M. Saâdane. Despite being reduced to 10 men after Hussain Al Sibyani received a red card in the 59th minute, Al Shabab regained the lead with goals from Vitinho in the 72nd minute and Musab Al Juwayr in the 89th minute. Al-Fateh managed a late goal in stoppage time from J. Denayer, but it was not enough to overturn the result. The match featured several substitutions and a VAR review, with referee Abdullah Al-Harbi officiating the game.

Al Akhdoud secured a 2-0 victory over Al Taee in their Pro League match at the Prince Abdul Aziz bin Musa'ed Stadium in Hail. The first goal came in the 42nd minute when S. Godwin scored with an assist from Naif Asiri, giving Al Akhdoud a 1-0 lead at halftime. L. Tawamba extended the lead in the 50th minute with another goal for the away team. The match saw several yellow cards, with both teams committing fouls, and a VAR review in stoppage time overturned a potential red card for Al Taee's Bernard Mensah. Despite Al Taee making multiple substitutions in the second half, they were unable to find the back of the net, and Al Akhdoud emerged as the winners.

Al Riyadh secured a 2-1 victory over Al Khaleej Saihat in their Pro League match at the Prince Mohamed bin Fahd Stadium in Dammam. After a goalless first half, Al Riyadh took the lead in the 68th minute with a penalty scored by B. Touré, followed by a second goal in the 74th minute from Andre Gray. Al Khaleej Saihat responded in the 87th minute with a penalty converted by Abdullah Al Salem but could not find an equalizer. The match saw several yellow cards, including one for Andre Gray and Mohammed Al Shwirekh of Al Riyadh, as well as Naif Masoud and Ivo Rodrigues of Al Khaleej Saihat. The game concluded with Al Riyadh as the winners, while referee Sami Al Jires officiated the match.

Damac and Al-Raed played to a 1-1 draw in their Pro League match at Dhamak Club Stadium in Khamis Mushait. Damac took an early lead in the 7th minute with a goal from F. Chafaï, assisted by G. Nkoudou, after an earlier Al-Raed goal by Raed Al-Ghamdi was disallowed by VAR in the 3rd minute. The equalizer came late in the match when Al-Raed benefited from an own goal by Abdulbasit Hawsawi in the 89th minute. The game saw several substitutions and yellow cards, with both teams making four changes and Al-Raed receiving three yellow cards while Damac received one. Referee Abdulsamad Bakri officiated the match, which ended after 90 minutes of play.
